subject: Creativity
title: Comedy as Therapy: Laughing Through Pain
description: A quick win: understand Comedy as Therapy: Laughing Through Pain.

hook.text: Patch Adams wore a clown nose in hospitals and patients recovered faster.

buildup.text: Humor therapy is now used for PTSD, depression, chronic pain, and cancer treatment.

discovery.text: Norman Cousins cured his ankylosing spondylitis partly through comedy â€” watching Marx Brothers films daily.

twist.text: Comedy isn't escapism from pain. Neuroscience shows laughter actually reorganizes how the brain processes pain signals.

climax.text: Stand-up comedy workshops for veterans show significant PTSD symptom reduction.

punchline.text: Laughter doesn't make the pain disappear. It makes you bigger than the pain.

quiz.question: By how much can laughter increase pain tolerance?
